III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
2.) The clients served by the facility are not part of the plaintiff class and therefor the
facility is not required to follow the ISEP.
3.) The facility does not hold a contract with MDHHS/Children Services, so it is not
subject to contract or policy requirements.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility did not require technical assistance at this time.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility did not require consultation at this time.
EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Since the facility’s interim inspection in 2020 the facility had a Special Evaluation
2021C0103011 in which a staff had inappropriate relationships with youth at the
facility, at another facility, and youth who had been discharged. The investigation did
have a finding of maltreatment in care and the facility was placed on a first provisional
license. The facility was cited for R 400.4109 Program statement due to staff not
following the facility’s code of conduct. Because of the inappropriate nature of the
contact between the staff and youth the facility was cited for R 400.4112 Criminal
history check, subject to requirements: staff qualifications. They were also cited for R
400.4126 Sufficiency of staff due to female staff being left alone with male residents.
4

Throughout this six-month period the facility has done extensive work to train their
staff and supervisors on the code of conduct and appropriate boundaries between
staff and youth. Monthly unannounced visits to the home found that the facility had
hired new staff and when questioned the new and old staff all confirmed their
trainings in boundaries and the code of conduct. The facility is in the process of hiring
a new supervisor. All corrective actions were implemented and continue to be in
place.
As with many other CCI’s in the State of Michigan Samaritas Jackson House
struggles to find quality staff. They have posted positions in many different forums
and have offered incentives, yet it is still a struggle. The facility maintains their staff to
youth ratio however they are relying on a fewer number of staff to fill the shifts.
There have been no other findings or concerns since the provisional license was
issued.
VI. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the facility be issued a regular license.
